question: 我が国
sourceMnemonic:
You learned that <ja>我が</ja> means "our", so our <kanji>country</kanji> is simply <vocabulary>our country</vocabulary>.

Just like <ja>我が</ja> itself, this expression is somewhat old-fashioned and stylized. It comes up a lot in political discourse and other formal contexts.
sourceReadingMnemonic: You learned this reading for <ja>我</ja> when you learned <ja>我が</ja>. Just watch out for <ja>国</ja>, which you might expect to rendaku here, but doesn't!
